description: This contemporary public affairs course examines normative commitments and
empirical evidence relevant to the workings of government, markets, and society as
applied to contemporary issues.  Possible topics include immigration, abortion,
education, sexuality, medical care, foreign policy, income inequality and poverty,
affirmative action, and responses to climate change.  Not open to first-year students.
Offered annually in the spring semester. Prerequisite: PACON 280.
